description:
Hikari Hanazono has always been second to Kei Takishima. When they were six years old, their pro-wrestling loving fathers introduced them to each other. Assuming that she was the best in wrestling, young Hikari challenged Kei to a wrestling match only to be thoroughly defeated by him.

Ever since that fateful incident, Hikari swore to beat Kei in school grades, sporting events - anything. To do this, she has enrolled in the same school as Kei since elementary. Now she attends Hakusenkan, an ultra elite school, that costs her carpenter father a lot of money.

Hikari and Kei are the top two students in the school, with Kei holding firmly to that number one position. While Hikari considers Kei to be a rival and important friend, she is completely unaware that Kei loves her. The story primarily focuses on Hikari and her constant attempts to defeat her one and only rival, Kei, and how she finds love in their rivalry.

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Wrestling
tags.description: Centers around the sport of wrestling.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Musical Theater
tags.description: Features a performance that combines songs, spoken dialogue, acting, and dance.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Maids
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a maid.

tags.name: Incest
tags.description: Features sexual or romantic relations between characters who are related by blood.

[Profile (Pony Canyon)](https://www.ponycanyon.co.jp/artist/31356600) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/black_fukuyama)

Fukuyama released his debut music album "Romantic World 31" on his birthday (November 26) in 2009, his second album "Love Letters 2: Paris Romantic" on July 21, 2010, his third album "Fukuyama Jun, Ai wo Utau!" on May 25, 2011, and his fourth album "Love Letter 3 ~Matsuri no Kuni de~" on May 22, 2013. He also appeared in a 2009 romantic comedy movie Fujoshi Kanojo in a cameo role.

**Height:** 151.6 cm

[Official Website](https://www.takagakiayahi.com/) | [Music Ray'n profile](https://musicrayn.com/takagaki_ayahi) | [Official Blog](https://ameblo.jp/takagakiayahi-blog/)

Ayahi Takagaki graduated from a Tokyo music college majoring in operatic singing. Her professionally trained operatic voice can be heard in songs like "Life", "Inori" or "Justice".

One of the members of Seiyuu Group, [Sphere](https://anilist.co/staff/103636).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Aloy - Genshin Impact

Debuted in 2001 with Kanata no Ao (Faraway Blue).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/minaminikulove)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/oitan125) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/花田十輝)

Jukki Hanada is a Japanese screenwriter and novelist. He is the grandson of literary critic and essayist Kiyoteru Hanada. He formerly belonged to [Takao Koyama's](https://anilist.co/staff/117575/Takao-Koyama) Brother Noppo anime scenario house. He's currently affiliated with SATZ.

He's a big fan of professional baseball and supports the Hiroshima Toyo Carp.

**Height:** 151.6 cm

[Official Website](https://www.takagakiayahi.com/) | [Music Ray'n profile](https://musicrayn.com/takagaki_ayahi) | [Official Blog](https://ameblo.jp/takagakiayahi-blog/)

Ayahi Takagaki graduated from a Tokyo music college majoring in operatic singing. Her professionally trained operatic voice can be heard in songs like "Life", "Inori" or "Justice".

Formerly affiliated with [AIC](https://anilist.co/studio/48/AIC), currently working at [Senju Kobo](https://anilist.co/studio/7581/Senju-Kobo).
